job_title: Clinical Education Specialist in Hartford, CT
pros: The mission of CCMC is excellent. Many opportunities to learn and grow in pediatric medicine. Love the patients and families. Some wonderful doctors and clinicians on staff.
cons: Administration and leadership are all about the almighty dollar. At the end of the day, middle to upper management are striving for their respective departments and do not collaborate well amongst each other. Willing to sacrifice frontline staff at any cost to protect their goals and incentives related to their department. SO many EXCELLENT staff were driven away from this company because of toxic leadership. High burnout rate. Very high staff turnover. Inconsistent and unclear policies and procedures.

pros: Other than upper management, staff is great to work with in some departments.  If lucky enough to work with an honest, hard working and friendly team, the environment is great even with horrible leadership.
cons: No Salary negotiations considered.  You get what you get, regardless of experience or dedication over the period of employment.  Annual merit increases occasionally when possible, usually ~1%. Work load will increase two times quicker than your merit. Keep your mouth shut when it comes to management, and you'll be allowed to remain content within your position. Other than that, you are considered a number, not a value to the org unless you are a Doctor. No room for growth.

pros: The work being done on behalf of the Children of Connecticut at this hospital is second to none. The staff is incredibly dedicated and is passionate about protecting the well-being and health of children. From clinical trials to facilities management, everyone I came into contact with was 100% invested in the mission of this hospital. For the time I was fortunate enough to work there, I felt a part of a select group of individuals that had a "higher calling" and it was a great feeling.
cons: Some internal politics got in the way of some of the work being performed.

review_title: Nice place to sharpen your skills but not a forever home.
job_title: Emergency Department Technician in Hartford, CT
pros: Great environment for pediatric experience. The emergency department is very busy. Lots of opportunity for learning about pediatrics. There is also fair amount of room for growth.
cons: The management of the emergency department is struggling. There is a ton of turnover here. In the last year there has been over 50% turnover in the emergency department nursing staff. It is widely known that entry level staff here are underpaid compared to other area hospitals.

review_title: It's all about the kids, if you can get past the poor upper Management
pros:
Caring for the kids. Those providing direct patient care work hard to achieve good outcomes.
Great specialty physicians
You will work hard and the rewards are those pats you give yourself, along with families who appreciate what you do.
Work here because you love to help the kids.
cons:
Horrible management. They cover up their inadaquicies. 
Blame falls on those working in the trenches.
CEO has no clue what is happening downstream. 
House cleaning needed for management that had no ideas how to lead.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Britain, CT
pros: Staff really cares about their jobs, students and other staff.  Plenty of training is offered.  Good benefits are very good compared to other similar work places.
cons: Administration is more concerned with the dollar than with staff concerns.  Once you questions something about the company you have a target on your back. Safety of staff seems to have taken a dive in the past few years.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Hartford, CT
pros: Great company to work for. Really care about patient care and families. I learned so much working on a med/surg floor. The kids are great!
cons: Bad management on certain units which created bad attitudes in some employees. Management has favorites and they can get away with anything while you work your butt off. A lot of continuing education online which you don't have time for working days so you have to do it at home without getting paid. Can be emotionally draining seeing some of the childrens injuries.

pros: Working with children, families and some of the staff. There are actual  people who enjoy what they do. There is some staff left that is pleasant to work with,  professional, care for others and don't value their job as just being a paycheck.
cons: Poor management and leadership. No support from upper management or HR.   Hard workers are  mistreated and the slackers are rewarded.  A few bad apples will cause the entire basket to go bad. If you are not cunning and manipulative, you will not survive. Witness to unprofessional and unethical work environment.  The health coverage is expensive.

review_title: Kids are fun, Management is lacking
pros: Enjoying working in a child centered atmosphere with a great mission.
cons: Upper management/directors/VPs are obsessed with meaningless awards/status/magnet as marketing strategies. Sight is lost on the needs of front line staff. Well known that directors and other admin get bonuses and incentives while frontline staff don’t get raises that even cover the cost increase of health insurance benefits.

job_title: Pediatric Occupational Therapist in Glastonbury, CT
pros: Great company and rehab team. The rehab manager was very supportive and willing to assist with new or unfamiliar treatments/diagnoses. Reasonable productivity standards, opportunities for growth and continuing education.
cons: Lower hourly rate than other settings; high no show rate but scheduled at 90% productivity so if all of your patients show up there is no paperwork time.

review_title: The veneer of working for a children's hospital wears thin very quickly.
pros: Kids are great, and Connecticut Children's helps make them better
cons: The disengaged senior management team and the directors who are out for one thing - maintaining their ridiculous salaries and jobs.

pros: Good health insurance, growing company, great healthcare staff.
cons: Limited to no career advancement opportunities depending on job area, staff contributions not always valued by management.

pros: Rewarding work helping children in need, family still go back and visit with my past coworkers.
cons: Too high price of health care, more work to do less people to do it, less pay, little or no increases.

pros: The employees love their jobs and healing children
cons: Management stinks. They need an overhaul of their supervisors. Some have no people skills and can't manage employees fairly and impartially.

pros: Benefits are decent, free-standing children's hospital, continuing education offered
cons: not a good environment for a new graduate APRN, no fellowship program, VERY limited orientation, no structured orientation process

job_title: Senior Budget Analyst in Hartford, CT
pros: Great mission, quality of care and compassion from front line caregivers
cons: Strong sense of mission at the top, and committed to quality measures at the front, but very poor communication and acceptance by middle management.

pros:
The only free standing children's hospital in the State
The mission is part of everyday practice

NO SACRED COWS!

review_title: I loved working at the Children's Hospital! Great Staff, Caring Doctors and Nurses and great kids to take care of.
